definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Americans continue to debate how to interpret the Second Amendment.
sentences.chinese: 美國人爲如何解釋第二修正案繼續辯論。

sentences.english: I can out-argue you any day.
sentences.chinese: 任何時候我都可以在辯論中勝過你。

sentences.english: The issue of human rights is widely agitated.
sentences.chinese: 人權問題引起廣泛而激烈的辯論。

sentences.english: Ma won a debate competition for Asian college students 22 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 早在22年前，他就贏得“亞洲大專辯論會”的獎盃。

sentences.english: Parliamentary debate would supposedly give the game away.
sentences.chinese: 議會辯論可能會露出馬腳。

sentences.english: One of the main reasons for debating is to find solutions to prob¬lems.
sentences.chinese: 辯論的一個主要原因是爲了尋找問題的解決方案。

sentences.english: The two sides since the debate continues.
sentences.chinese: 兩方辯論至今仍在繼續。

sentences.english: We argued with them about the new law.
sentences.chinese: 我們同他們辯論那項新法律。

sentences.english: The argument culminated in a fist fight.
He has refused to take part in TV debates or give press conferences.
sentences.chinese: 他拒絕參加電視辯論，也不召開新聞發佈會。
我們應該開始辯論這些問題。

sentences.english: My only argument was that assuming anything at this point, is totaly wrong!
sentences.chinese: 拋開這個不談，我們是從不同的觀點來辯論一件事情。

sentences.english: This tone has prevailed through subsequent commemorations and debates.
sentences.chinese: 這一基調在過去的紀念活動和辯論中成爲主流。

sentences.english: The European Union, meanwhile, is largely absent from this debate.
sentences.chinese: 同時，歐盟很大程度上是缺席這場辯論的。

definition: to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
aspect/facet/level (political, psychological, spiritual etc)/(geology) bedding plane
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
